item.title: Classification of ITPFI factors
item.description: arXiv:2503.10807v2 Announce Type: new Abstract: In this paper we prove precise descriptions for each of type-$III_0$, type-$III_{\lambda}$ and type-$III_1$ ITPFI factors based on their asymptotic ratio set.
item.dc:creator: Tianyi Zhou

item.title: A quantum Frucht's theorem and quantum automorphisms of quantum Cayley graphs
item.description: arXiv:2503.11149v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: We establish a quantum version of Frucht's Theorem, proving that every finite quantum group is the quantum automorphism group of an undirected finite quantum graph. The construction is based on first considering several quantum Cayley graphs of the quantum group in question, and then providing a method to systematically combine them into a single quantum graph with the right symmetry properties. We also show that the dual $\widehat \Gamma$ of any non-abelian finite group $\Gamma$ is ``quantum rigid''. That is, $\widehat \Gamma$ always admits a quantum Cayley graph whose quantum automorphism group is exactly $\widehat \Gamma$.
item.dc:creator: Michael Brannan, Daniel Gromada, Junichiro Matsuda, Adam Skalski, Mateusz Wasilewski

item.title: Induced Representation of Topological groupoids
item.description: arXiv:2503.11403v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Let $G$ be a locally compact second countable groupoid with a Haar system. In this article, we introduce the induced representation of $G$ from a continuous unitary representation of a closed wide subgroupoid $H$ with a Haarsystem provided there exists a full equivariant system of measures $\mu=\{\mu^{u}\}_{u\in G^{0}}$ on $G/H$. We prove some basic properties of induced representation and a theorem on induction in stages. A groupoid version of Mackey's tensor product theorem is also provided. We also prove a groupoid version of Frobenius Reciprocity theorem on compact transitive groupoids.
item.dc:creator: K. N. Sridharan, N. Shravan Kumar

item.title: Twisted convolution algebras with coefficients in a differential subalgebra
item.description: arXiv:2309.08846v3 Announce Type: replace Abstract: Let $({\sf G},\alpha, \omega,\mathfrak B)$ be a measurable twisted action of the locally compact group ${\sf G}$ on a Banach $^*$-algebra $\mathfrak B$ and $\mathfrak A$ a differential Banach $^*$-subalgebra of $\mathfrak B$, which is stable under said action. We observe that $L^1_{\alpha,\omega}({\sf G},\mathfrak A)$ is a differential subalgebra of $L^1_{\alpha,\omega}({\sf G},\mathfrak B)$. We use this fact to provide new examples of groups with symmetric Banach $^*$-algebras. In particular, we prove that discrete rigidly symmetric extensions of compact groups are symmetric or that semidirect products ${\sf K}\rtimes{\sf H}$, with ${\sf H}$ symmetric and ${\sf K}$ compact, are symmetric.
item.dc:creator: Felipe I. Flores

item.title: Polynomial growth and functional calculus in algebras of integrable cross-sections
item.description:
arXiv:2401.09730v3 Announce Type: replace-cross Abstract: Let ${\sf G}$ be a locally compact group with polynomial growth of order $d$, a polynomial weight $
u$ on ${\sf G}$ and a Fell bundle $\mathscr C\overset{q}{	o}{\sf G}$. We study the Banach $^*$-algebras $L^1({\sf G}\,\vert\,\mathscr C)$ and $L^{1,
u}({\sf G}\,\vert\,\mathscr C)$, consisting of integrable cross-sections with respect to ${m d} x$ and $
u(x){m d} x$, respectively. By exploring new relations between the $L^p$-norms and the norm of the Hilbert $C^*$-module $L^2_{m e}({\sf G}\,\vert\,\mathscr C)$, we are able to show that the growth of the self-adjoint, compactly supported, continuous cross-sections is polynomial. More precisely, they satisfy $$\|{e^{it\Phi}}\|=O(|t|^n),\quad	ext{ as }|t|	o\infty,$$ for values of $n$ that only depend on $d$ and the weight $
u$. We use this fact to develop a smooth functional calculus for such elements. We also give some sufficient conditions for these algebras to be symmetric. As consequences, we show that these algebras are locally regular, $^*$-regular and have the Wiener property (when symmetric), among other results. Our results are already new for convolution algebras associated with $C^*$-dynamical systems.
